intro: Coussarea chariantha, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant derives some of its nutrients from its host trees, typically members of the Dipterocarpaceae family. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Coussarea chariantha plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, supporting various insect species and contributing to the biodiversity of forest ecosystems.
